result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon J Sommerfelt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carrying A Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Submit a DNA sample by October 27th, 2022 and pay the surcharge by October 25th, 2024.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
Pay a fine of $500.00 plus all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges. Pay by October 25th, 2024. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon J Sommerfelt

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon J Sommerfelt in court.  Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt in court for Brandon J Sommerfelt.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

AS TO COUNT ONE; Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    

AS TO COUNT ONE; 

- Pay a fine of $500.00 plus all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges. Pay by October 25th, 2024.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Submit a DNA sample by October 27th, 2022 and pay the surcharge by October 25th, 2024.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.
Received and Filed. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Brandon J Sommerfelt in court with Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/LIVE ON DACAST.  Case in court for pretrial conference.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court set date as requested.  This matter will be held in person in room 623 of the Courthouse.  Effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15 in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed by Attorney Mark Schoenfeldt

Adjustment Number: 22A 061213,
Payable Number: 1017378,
Receipt Number: 22RP026876,
Amount: $20.00

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 07-03-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Brandon J Sommerfelt in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7-1-2022 @1:30p
